Description: Fragment of oval handle from neck join to sharp turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine beige-buff. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 124 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 143.)
Curator's comments: Name Teisamenos. From the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 010.02.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (277)
